frame.name: Substance
frame.definition:
<def-root>This frame concerns internally undifferentiated <fen>Substance</fen>s.
<ex>As their gut bacteria ferment cellulose , they generate <fex name="con">methane</fex> <t>gas</t> , which escapes from the rear ends of the insects.</ex>
<ex> The pipes are leaking <fex name="des">noxious</fex> <t>gas</t>.</ex>
<ex>Some CH-47 "Bombers" were equipped to roll-out <fex name="use">riot control</fex> <t>gas</t> or napalm onto Viet Cong bunker complexes from the rear cargo ramp.</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Constituents
FE.definition:
<def-root>The frame element expresses substances/ingredients that make up the Substance.
<ex><fex name="con">Argon</fex> <t>gas</t> is added into the station's air mixture.</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Substance
FE.definition:
<def-root>The undifferentiated entity which is presented as having a permanent existence.
<ex><fex name="sub"><t>Liquid</t></fex> flowed over the rocks but it was not water.</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Type
FE.definition:
<def-root>This FE indicates what subtype of the general category the <fen>Substance</fen> belongs to.
<ex><fex name="typ">Greenhouse</fex> <t>gases</t> trap heat and prevent its escape from the atmosphere.</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Origin
FE.definition:
<def-root>The location that the <fen>Substance</fen> comes from, including both extraction sites and emission/production sources.
<ex>It retrieves most of the expensively generated heat from <fex name="sou">flue</fex> <t>gases</t> and puts this heat back into the system.</ex> <ex> The transport of <fex name="sou">Iraqi</fex> <t>petroleum</t> and petroleum products through the Kirkuk- Yumurtalik pipeline in Turkey is authorized by paragraph 1 a.</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Descriptor
FE.definition:
<def-root>A characterization of the <fen>Substance</fen>.
<ex>The new Chrysler minivans will run on <fex name="Descriptor">compressed</fex> natural <t>gas</t>.</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Inherent_purpose
FE.definition:
<def-root>The purpose for which the <fen>Substance</fen> is intended.
<ex>Supply and placing of <fex name="Inherent_purpose">filler</fex> <t>sand</t> shall be incidental to installation of the paving stones.</ex></def-root>

lexUnit.name: gas.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: an air-like fluid substance which expands freely to fill any space available, irrespective of its quantity.

lexUnit.name: sand.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: a loose granular substance, typically pale yellowish brown, resulting from the erosion of siliceous and other rocks and forming a major constituent of beaches, river beds, the seabed, and deserts

lexUnit.name: oil.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: a viscous liquid derived from petroleum, used especially as a fuel or lubricant.

lexUnit.name: liquid.n
lexUnit.definition: FN: a substance that flows freely but is of constant volume.

lexUnit.name: methane.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: a colourless, odourless flammable gas which is the main constituent of natural gas and the simplest member of the alkane series

lexUnit.name: chemical.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: a distinct compound or substance, especially one which has been artificially prepared or purified.

lexUnit.name: iron.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: a strong, hard magnetic silvery-grey metal, the chemical element of atomic number 26, used in construction and manufacturing (especially as steel).

lexUnit.name: material.n
lexUnit.definition: FN: matter

lexUnit.name: uranium.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: the chemical element of atomic number 92, a grey dense radioactive metal used as a fuel in nuclear reactors.

lexUnit.name: aluminum.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: a strong, light, corrosion-resistant silvery-grey metal, the chemical element of atomic number 13

lexUnit.name: plutonium.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: the chemical element of atomic number 94, a dense silvery radioactive metal of the actinide series, used as a fuel in nuclear reactors and as an explosive in nuclear fission weapons.

lexUnit.name: atropine.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: a poisonous compound found in deadly nightshade, used in medicine as a muscle relaxant.

lexUnit.name: yellowcake.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: impure uranium oxide obtained during processing of uranium ore.

lexUnit.name: solid.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: a substance of constant shape and size that resists the tendency to flow and does not easily deform.

lexUnit.name: ore.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: a naturally occurring solid material from which a metal or valuable mineral can be extracted profitably.

lexUnit.name: petroleum.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: a hydrocarbon oil found in suitable rock strata and extracted and refined to produce fuels including petrol, paraffin, and diesel oil; oil.

lexUnit.name: water.n
lexUnit.definition: FN: H2O as a substance

lexUnit.name: juice.n
lexUnit.definition: FN: a liquid that can be extracted from or is present within some other entity.

lexUnit.name: metal.n
lexUnit.definition: FN: a substance made up of one or more electro-positive elements, typically having a shiny surface and being conductive and malleable.

lexUnit.name: glass.n
lexUnit.definition: FN: an amorphous, brittle, transparent or translucent material made of silica and (virtually always) alkaline salts.

lexUnit.name: paper.n
lexUnit.definition: FN: a physical entity, usually in sheet form, made out of wood pulp or other fibrious material normally used for written or printed communication

lexUnit.name: mud.n
lexUnit.definition: FN: a viscous mixture of earth and water.

lexUnit.name: cement.n
lexUnit.definition: FN: a self-hardening substance composed primarily of heated limestone.

lexUnit.name: calcium.n
lexUnit.definition: FN: An Element

lexUnit.name: oxygen.n
lexUnit.definition: FN: a colorless, odorless gas, the chemical element of atomic number 8

lexUnit.name: fertilizer.n
lexUnit.definition: FN: a substance used to fertilize the soil (especially a commercial or chemical manure)
